item.title: Report X-2024101206
item.description:
Report X-2024101206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: SAVANNAH
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THe shipment was discovered leaking in the drivers van during offload. The package was picked up by FedEx and found leaking when the vehicle arrived at the station. Absorbent pads and vermiculite were used to contain and clean up the spill. No other packages were affected. The package contained 4 metal cans in a fiberboard box surrounded in bubble wrap, and overpacked. 3 metal cans were leaking from the top. The remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024100455
item.description:
Report E-2024100455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver was in the process of delivering Aromatic Petroleum Distillates into the customer's storage tank. The driver inadvertently disconnected a delivery hose that was still under pressure. This allowed approximately 60 gallons of product to be released. Customer personnel handled the remediation. A small amount of product was able to spray onto the driver and resulted in them seeking medical treatment.

item.title: Report E-2024100404
item.description:
Report E-2024100404

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T09:15:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NAT experienced a UN1219 Isopropyl Alcohol 99% release from (2) 55-gallon metal drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct onsite cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 20’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. Each drum that was damaged was containerized into a 65-gallon metal overpack along with the impacted absorbents. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024100939
item.description:
Report X-2024100939

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: GAINESVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 7th, these shipment was dropped off at one of the FedEx Drop locations. Once it was brought to the station there was ammunition noticed through the holes used for handles in the boxes. There are 3 banker boxes and a plastic tote that contain 50+ boxes of ammunition, including one fibreboard box and one plastic bag that had loose ammunition in them. The ammunition is of various calibers. The packages were not marked or labeled as dangerous goods. The packages were placed in a managers office and are being held pending disposition of an FAA investigation.
